content: If there are no entries in Saved Passwords, you would be prompted for one when TB connects to the mail server, such as when TB is restarted. At that point, check the box in the prompt to have the password saved. That is, unless passwords are managed by an external app of the kind that is part of some security suites.

content:
FRom the 'Menu Bar' toolbar: 'View' > 'Message Body As' Offers 3 options - Original html, Simple html and Plain Text

You can use those options to swap the view of email.

But at this moment - what options have you got selected on each computer?

Plain text does not contain formatting because they are plain text. So if the email used a table to format the positioning of content, then in Plain Text mode that 'table' formatting would be removed. But if bullets were used in a html then they should still display in plain text mode.

Currently, I do not know what is contained in the source. Can you offer some info?

Check if email has been sent with both plain text and html. Select email so it displays in Message Pane In the headers area - Click on 'More' and click on 'View Source' It opens in a new window. Look for these lines:

  • Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
  • Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"

If contents only have the text/plain option then email was only sent as plain text. If it has both then email was composed using html, but it's likely you are viewing it in Plain Text mode.

What do you see in the source?

Providing there isn't anything too sensitive - it would be handy to post images of what you see.

Then I'll know what settings you currently use, what info is in view source and the image showing results.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: De tekst in de gele banner "We zullen u nooit vragen een telefoonnummer te bellen, er een sms naar te sturen of persoonlijke gegevens te delen" is een waarschuwing voor scams die voor kunnen komen door het gebruik van een forum, dit heeft niets te maken met het het donatieformulier. Daar is nu eenmaal bepaalde minimale informatie voor nodig: "We begrijpen dat uw privacy zeer belangrijk is. Daarom vragen we om een minimale hoeveelheid aan gegevens die nodig zijn om donaties te verwerken, waaronder factureringsadressen. Om frauduleuze betalingen te voorkomen, gebruiken we adressen in ons interne beoordelingsproces. Uw gegevens worden priv√© gehouden - als u vragen hebt, wend u dan tot ons [https://www.mozilla.org/privacy/websites/ Privacybeleid]. Als u liever niet uw gegevens op ons online donatieformulier invult, kunt u een cheque of geldwissel toesturen."

content:
As you are probably aware - the 'Cards View' is new and constantly under development. So it's inevitable that alterations/modifications to code will occur.

The image shows you are currently using the 'Card View' in version 115.15.0

It would be helpful if you could post the content of your 'userChrome.css' file, so I can copy what you are currently using. Then it's possible to replicate your current state.

If you choose to use 128*: 'Tools' > 'Developer Tools' > 'Developer Toolbox' Alllow connection This can be used to identify the areas which you want to tweak. It can be used to help you modify the 'userChrome.css'.

content:
To confirm the trash folder, I suggest deleting a message and see what happens to it. if it goes to your deleted folder, that is the trash folder. there should be a trash or delete in left sidebar and a right click should offer option to 'empty trash.' After emptying trash, you could do this to verify what folders you have:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformaiton
  2. search for 'profile folder' in left side and then click 'open folder'
  3. exit thunderbird
  4. you are now in profile. click the imapmail folder if imap account or Mail folder if POP. click the account name and the various message folders and their sizes should appear. From here, you can see the sizes of all your folders and if there is a trash folder.
  5. another consideration is to click Tools>clear recent history to ensure cache is clear as you don't want to save that either.
  6. if imap, I also suggest rightclicking accountname in main screen and clicking 'subscribe' to see what folders you are using.
  7. TIP: if imap and if you have multi-megabytes of data, you can delete the message files in windows file explorer when thunderbird is not running to save copying them, as thunderbird will repopulate when restarted.
creator: davidsk

content:
For Cards View, this can be done with css: 

.card-container {     background-color: var(--tag-color) !important; }


To make just the card text have the tag colour: 

.card-container {     color: var(--tag-color) !important; }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

content:
I think the smtp for the jeffmunk account won't work with OAuth2, since (I think) smtp.bizmail.yahoo.com isn't supported with OAuth2 in TB (imap.mail.yahoo.com is OK). Try changing it to smtp.mail.yahoo.com, which does work with OAuth2, and is consistent with the IMAP server. Remove the entries for the account from Saved Passwords, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth2 window. There should be a single oauth:// token in Saved Passwords that works for incoming and outgoing.

If that doesn't work, see this topic about adding the account in Yahoo webmail settings:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1462414
creator: sfhowes

content:
Merci ! Thanks! This worked out perfectly. But I need to tell you a few things. The first and the most important thing to know is that the deleting of the Saved Passwords for the non-working account was the key issue. There were multiples ones saved in there. Once I quit TB and went back in to the troubled account, it forced a new browser window up for me to log into my Turbify Business E-mail account (Yahoo). Once I did that, all my undeleted email showed up in my TB mailbox.

Outgoing mail worked as well but here's the thing to note. imap.mail.yahoo.com worked fine but I waited a bit for it to arrive. Just for the hell of it I also tried imap.bizmail.yahoo.com and that work just as well and maybe arrived a bit faster.

The other 3 account I use with TB are also domain name email account. Two are from another domain and the other one yet another domain. All are hosted by Turbify, all use the imap.bizmail.yahoo.com smtp setting and those 3 work consistently while mine did not. Clearly this was a password issue.
